intro: Eriospermum alcicorne, commonly known as the silky eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its silvery-green coloration. Eriospermum alcicorne is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
